intro: Trichosporum brachysepalum, commonly known as the short-sepal trichosporum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically have four to five petals. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Trichosporum brachysepalum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
